label: AB_mC16_12_2i_2i-002
title: $\beta$-BiI Structure
comments:
BiI occurs naturally in three phases, with high pressure phases predicted to occur (Deng, 2019).  All of the natural phases are in space group $C2/m$ \#12, with atoms on the (4i) Wyckoff positions.  The only difference between the structures is the stacking of the atoms. \begin{itemize} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_mC32_12_4i_4i-001}{$\alpha$-BiI} is the ground state structure. \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_mC16_12_2i_2i-002}{$\beta$-BiI} (this structure) is metastable at room temperature and stable above 564K. \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_mC16_12_2i_2i-003}{$\gamma$-BiI} is formed at 580K. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_mC16_12_2i_2i-001}{SrN}, \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_mC16_12_2i_2i-002}{$\beta$-BiI}, and \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_mC16_12_2i_2i-003}{$\gamma$-BiI} share the same AFLOW prototype label, AB\_mC16\_12\_2i\_2i. The structures are generated by the same symmetry operations with different sets of parameters ({\tt --params}) specified in their corresponding CIF files.
